level.heading: Signing and filing of records pursuant to judicial order.

level.text: If a person required by this chapter to sign or deliver a record to the Mayor for filing does not do so, the Superior Court, upon petition of an aggrieved person, may order:
The person to sign the record and deliver it to the Mayor for filing; or
Delivery of the unsigned record to the Mayor for filing.

An aggrieved person under subsection (a) of this section, other than the limited cooperative association or foreign cooperative to which the record pertains, shall make the association or foreign cooperative a party to the action brought to obtain the order.
An unsigned record filed pursuant to this section shall be effective.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under ยง 29-101.01.

level.heading: Uniform Law:
level.text: This section is based on ยง 202 of the Uniform Limited Cooperative Association Act . See Vol. 6A , Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition or ULA Database on Westlaw.
